author: Special Correspondent
text:
The CITU observed Martyrs Day on Tuesday to pay respect to the memory of three leaders of farm workers who were killed in police firing on this day in 1982.

K. S. Gopikumar, state committee member of CITU, administered oath to the participants on the occasion.

V. Kumar, State Deputy General Secretary of the CITU, D. Udayakumar, district secretary of the CITU, S. P. Thangavel, district secretary of the Tamil Nadu Vivasayigal Sangam and others spoke highlighting the workers struggle in the present day context.

The meeting urged the Government to fix Rs. 15,000 as minimum monthly wages for all sorts of workers, extend the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Programme to 250 days from the present 100 days and hike the daily wages to Rs.300, , fixing reasonable price for the agricultural produce as per the recommendation of Swaminathan Committee, and free house site pattas to all unorganised sector workers.
title: CITU observes Martyrs Day
